item.title: Auotoregressive Intregrated Moving Average (ARIMA)
item.description: Autoregressive integrated moving average (ARIMA) Autoregressive integrated moving average (ARIMA) is a statistical model that is used to forecast future values of a time series. It is a generalization of the autoregressive moving average (ARMA) model, which only considers the autocorrelations between the current value and the past values of the time series. ARIMA also considers the moving average of the residuals of the ARMA model, which helps to improve the accuracy of the forecasts.
